title: How im keeping "underpowered" nautilus alive....
body:
After 500k+ mastery,  Level 2 electrocute Nautilus is whats its come down to, and it works pretty consistently at my elo.

He hits like an ABSOLUTE TRUCK early with 100% electrocute accuracy after hook. (dont even think my ad auto attacked here and my ignite did not tick more than once). ** And he gets PLENTY tanky enough  mid-late with normal build pathing.**

if youre a thresh blitz main, or the enemy locks squishy, try this out, the kill potential is absolutely insane.

Edit: This works with basically any adc though kai made it a little insane here

replies.body: oof the %hp with the plasma combined with the electrocute rip

just tried and it was fun asf.
only thing is I'm not used to building ap, so what should I build?

> [{quoted}](name=Snapp2Kill,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lgEEEMzq,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-04-04T01:19:42.674+0000)
>
> just tried and it was fun asf.
> only thing is I'm not used to building ap, so what should I build?

Im not building ap at all, im running normal buildpath, but just running electrocute for the insane early game damage it offers on naut.

> [{quoted}](name=Snapp2Kill,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lgEEEMzq,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-04-04T02:17:27.645+0000)
>
> what secondary tree?

biscuits and boots, and i start relic and 3 pots like normal. This isnt even max possible level 2 damage but i do like the mana sustain biscuits offer early.

I'm inclined to say that was actually KaiSa helping more than you realize.

Nautilus: 250Damage (without factoring resists)
Hook - 80
1 Auto - 60
Passive - 14
W - 15 (1 tick)
Electrocute - 60
Ignite - 21 (1 tick)

KaiSa: 302Damage (without factoring resists)
W - 125
Q - 60
1 Auto - 70
Passive Proc - 47

Also please keep in mind.. you've landed your hook. Trying to land your hook plat+ is far more difficult due to positioning.
